review_title: Great people, wonderful CEO, strong mission

review_title: Plenty of opertunities, leading to eventual failure, band-aids and shots from the hip
job_title: Director of Applications in San Leandro, CA
pros: Company is great, vision, mission, CEO etc. IT has a great team of knowledgeable staff. Lot of IT systems in need of major overhaul, plenty of opportunities in this department.
cons: No support from C suite, they are unable to take constructive criticism, always add delays to requests, shots from the hip, would rather keep applying band-aids rather than making the patient better. Lots of work, plenty of challenges but all with no support

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Leandro, CA
pros: There are many smart, compassionate people working here. Benefits are good but would like other healthcare options. Pay is good for most staff members.
cons: 1. The pay could be better for support staff (claims, clerks, coordinators and customer care).  California's  minimum wage will soon match ours. 2. Only one health plan available. 3. Human Resources, get everything in writing when dealing with them.  4. No telecommuting.

review_title: Executive Team needs to pay attention to their actions or lack their of!
job_title: in San Leandro, CA
pros: Employees are awesome and support each other - this is why most people stay as long as they can before walking out!
cons: Executive Team to much chaos at Executive level!  They allow good employees to be run off by lack of back bone and walk the walk not talk a bunch of BS.  The company has many AWESOME employees that walk away after facing frustration of seeing preferential treatment at the Leadership level.  Who's really running the organization?

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Leandro, CA
pros: 1)  Mission is at the heart of the work here - to serve the underserved and expand quality health care to our communities. This message comes across from leadership, but also from employees, many of whom have been working here for years and are committed to the mission, 2) work-life balance, 3) smart leaders who are a mix of new and veterans
cons: The company has grown quickly so it's a bit cramped in here.  Also, with growth comes more structure. This is necessary when you grow, but can sometimes impede collaboration and speed.

review_title: No growth and asked to do more beyond your job description
job_title: in San Leandro, CA
pros: Free parking, warm people. Free Commuters checks, free cake every month. Free fruit every Tuesday. Free coffee and tea everyday. Quarterly meetings.
cons: There's no process in UM department, small increase each year. Too many things to do in UM, need to hire more nurses.

job_title: Prefer Not To Say in San Leandro, CA
pros: There are no pros to working for this company
cons: No matter how hard you work you will never be compensated, or awarded for your work.

review_title: Great Company, Great People and Great Mission
job_title: Chief Information Officer in San Leandro, CA
pros: The Community Health Center Network is dedicated to its mission of improving the lives of the under served and the CEO encourages teamwork and work life balance. Community Health Center Network has an incredible culture of caring professionals who go above and beyond the call to help people. A delightful environment to work in with a non-punitive, lets get it done together mentality.
cons: More emphasis needed on prioritization of tactical and strategic goals

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Leandro, CA
pros: The coworkers are really nice but no one gets to feel like there is any cohesion. The gatherings are stale and usually lack any authentic dialogue.
cons: There is no transparency at all. HR leads by fear and shuts people down quickly. There are policies that make no sense yet there is no interest in actually helping employees feel valued. It feels like an insurance agency- high turn over and no personality.

job_title: in San Leandro, CA
pros: Everybody is really passionate about healthcare and community health, upper management especially. Membership is increasing constantly, so there is always enough work to do. Since it is a small organization, your role literally does everything from start to end (a lot more responsibilities).
cons:
Small company which means their isn't much room for movement.
Every department is managed so differently.

review_title: Blessed to be a part of this wonderful organization!

pros:
